title: Introduction to Law
description: An introductory course covering the basics of legal systems, including common law and civil law traditions.

title: Constitutional Law
description: A comprehensive study of the principles and structure of the Constitution, focusing on the separation of powers and individual rights.

title: Criminal Law
description: An examination of criminal law, including the definitions and classifications of crimes, and the legal processes involved.

title: Contract Law
description: A study of the formation, interpretation, and enforcement of contracts, including breach and remedies.

title: Property Law
description: Covers the legal rules and principles governing the ownership and use of property, including real estate and personal property.

title: Torts
description: An exploration of civil wrongs and the legal mechanisms for addressing harm, including negligence and intentional torts.

title: Civil Procedure
description: The rules and standards that courts follow in civil litigation, including jurisdiction, pleadings, and trial processes.

title: Legal Research and Writing
description: Skills-based course focusing on legal research techniques and effective legal writing.

title: Family Law
description: Study of legal issues related to family relationships, including marriage, divorce, and child custody.

title: Business Associations
description: An examination of the law governing business organizations, including partnerships, corporations, and limited liability companies.

title: Administrative Law
description: Study of the legal principles governing administrative agencies, including rulemaking and adjudication.

title: International Law
description: An introduction to the legal principles and institutions governing international relations, including treaties and human rights.

title: Environmental Law
description: Exploration of legal issues related to environmental protection, including regulations and policies.

title: Tax Law
description: A study of the principles and rules of taxation, including income, corporate, and estate taxes.

title: Intellectual Property Law
description: Overview of the laws protecting intellectual property, including patents, copyrights, and trademarks.

title: Employment Law
description: Study of the laws governing employment relationships, including discrimination, labor unions, and workplace safety.

title: Evidence
description: Examines the rules and standards for presenting evidence in court, including relevance, hearsay, and privileges.

title: Legal Ethics
description: Covers the ethical responsibilities of lawyers, including client confidentiality, conflicts of interest, and professional conduct.

title: Human Rights Law
description: Study of the international and domestic laws protecting human rights, including key treaties and case law.

title: Jurisprudence
description: An exploration of philosophical theories about the nature of law and legal reasoning.

title: Bankruptcy Law
description: An examination of the legal processes involved in resolving financial insolvency, including liquidation and reorganization.

title: Cyber Law
description: Study of legal issues related to the internet and digital technologies, including privacy, cybercrime, and digital property.

title: Health Law
description: Exploration of legal issues in healthcare, including patient rights, medical ethics, and healthcare regulations.

title: Immigration Law
description: Study of the laws and policies governing immigration, citizenship, and asylum.

title: Real Estate Law
description: Covers legal issues related to real property, including transactions, land use, and leasing.

title: Sports Law
description: Explores legal issues in sports, including contracts, antitrust, and athlete rights.

title: Mediation and Arbitration
description: Study of alternative dispute resolution methods, focusing on mediation and arbitration processes.

title: Elder Law
description: An exploration of legal issues affecting the elderly, including estate planning, healthcare, and guardianship.

title: Juvenile Justice
description: Study of the juvenile justice system, including laws and procedures related to minors.

title: Animal Law
description: Examines legal issues concerning animals, including animal rights, welfare, and the regulation of animal industries.
